comment: Dr. Hillen is an amazing and kind professor. Make sure to participate in class discussions. Each test has a verbal and written component. She is a bit of a tough grader on the tests but as long as you explain your answers and thinking in detail you will pass. Make sure to pay attention and take notes during class even though the content seems easy.

Ignore all of the good reviews she is terrible and the worst professor I have had at ksu. Only positive is she is nice. She treats you and talks to you like you are 5 years old. Tests have nothing to do with in class content. The pace of the course is so slow. We spend 50 minutes going over simple fraction problem's. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!!!!!

Dr. Hillen is a supporter of all of her students and truly wants to see her students succeed. She always ensures that students understand the content we are learning. There were very short homework assignments, weekly quizzes, and 3 tests. She drops your 1/2 lowest quiz scores and your final can replace a test grade. Highly rec!

Dr.Hillen is very sweet and wants you to do well. Her tests can be difficult but take advantage of the study guide and sample assessments she provides. Attendance and engagement is very important so try to be there every class if you can.
Do not take her. The classes are a waste of time and tests are nothing like what is covered in class.

Dr. Hillen is a very sweet person but I would not recommend as a professor. She treats you like your children and class is a total waste of time. I honestly felt like I learned nothing. Not to mention, her tests never cover what we do in class and she takes forever to grade them. She is also a harsh grader and picks a part every thing on your test

She's really sweet and easy to get along with. Does move through material very slowly, so if you're struggling that would be good, but if you already have a good grasp on fractions, be prepared to exercise lots of patience. I was sick a lot through the semester, did usually make it to class, but I definitely felt like she cared about my health.

Dr. Hillen was one of the nicest professors I ever had. In terms of the homework load, it is relatively light, as she assigns homework every other week. However, the tests do not match what is taught in class and she also is a very harsh grader. In addition, there she offers two summative tests and weekly formative quizzes.

This class was not it for me. Half of class is like a broken record of nonsense. She grades things at the last minute, never fully answers questions, and lot of time is spent verbalizing your thoughts rather than practicing how to write it out and give her what she is looking for on paper (for tests/HW/quizzes). Is nice, teaching style is a no.

DO NOT TAKE HER! Takes forever to grade ANYTHING. You don't know how you are doing in the class until it's too late. Takes forever to reply to emails, you go over the same things in class for about a month. The most boring and useless class ever. Would not recommend her to anyone!!
Half of the things she teaches in class, aren't on the tests. Gives homework, the grades are not given back immediately. If you miss something, you will not be allowed to make it up.

I have taken her for 2 classes now and I loved her! I felt that the class was easy to follow along an easy class if you show up and pay attention. It takes her a while to grade, but other than that I absolutely recommend.
Dr. Hillen is a wonderful professor and person. She cares about her students on a level no other can reach. She is amazing and teaches in a way in which everyone can understand. I LOVE AMY HILLEN!

Do not take Professor Hillen. She is very sweet but that is not what the class is all about. We wasted so much time talking to our table partners and it seemed like that is what she was more focused on. She never answers directly when you ask about your grade in the course and she takes a very long time to grade tests (she grades extremely hard.)

I asked her how my grade is looking a month before the semester ended and honestly she told me not to worry that Im doing just fine and I passed her class with a C. Shes a tough grader. She waits till last day to turn in final grades and you dont really know what grade you have till the end when its too late.

Dr. Hillen is very sweet woman, but she grades so harshly on tests. The material we learn is not on the test. You do know where you are at until the very end of the semester or when grades are due. Participation matters 100% and attendance is mandatory. We did partner/group work everyday. She is always ready to help outside of class though.

Dr. Hillen is a nice professor and cares about her students, HOWEVER, her test are nothing like what we go over in class. She is a tough grader & takes FOREVER to grade exams. Lots of wasted class time at the beginning of class going over class procedures and getting to know our table group & lots of repetition in the class..

Dr. Hillen took so long to give us grades throughout the semsester and she spends too much time building community. She also gives tests that has nothing to do with what she covers. I will not be taking her again for 3317. Please take someone else.

Professor Hillen is very passionate about teaching but focuses more on community building rather than math. She doesnt put grades in until the end of semester. Tests are extremely hard and she will take off a lot of points for a tiny mistake. Will not be taking her again.

Dr Hillen is a very nice person, when she wants to be.... She speaks to you like you're stupid and will NEVER give you a clear answer. The beginning of the year was great but as time goes on it gets worse and worse. she takes for ever to grade assignments so you won't know your grade all semester. Would not recommend.

She is a super sweet lady, but is a super tough grader. The material is easy and if you ask for help, she will make time for you. Class participation and attendance is mandatory. The only issue I think everyone has had was you do not know your grade until the end. Tests took weeks to get back.

Professor Hillen is a nice lady, but it comes across as very condescending.  What she goes over in class is not even close to what is on her exams.  She never answers the questions you asks and forces things to make it seem like everything is so great and happy. I do not recommend taking her for any class.

Class is literally pointless. She takes forever to grade assignments/exams. Whatever is on the test, isn't what we learned during class. She is literally one of the reasons why I changed my major lol. I was waiting for a sign to tell me whether or not I should change my major. She was it. Anyways, good luck <3

Sweetest soul ever though.

I enjoyed Professor Hillen's class. She tries her best to engage with students and implements a no-judgement environment throughout the semester. She is always willing to assist after class time and that's a plus. I will definitely recommend taking her class! :)

She truly cares about you! You have two unexcused absences and two more with excuses. If you reach out to her she will be flexible with deadlines. She is always offering office hours. However, she does not provide written feedback or go over tests in class. BUT if you ask her to meet after class she will. Take responsibility and you will get an A+
You do not know where you're at in this class until the end of the semester and it's too late.

She was very caring and super sweet but overall I felt like this class was pointless. I learned two things this whole semester. She takes forever to grade you wont know your grade till after the semester. She doesn't go over test or homework and she takes points off easily. you'll do group work activities everyday and participation matters.

Takes awhile to grade tests, but very very sweet lady. She cares about her students a lot. Tons of group discussions in online class, but they are easy. She takes the time to really get to know her students. Pretty easy class.

She is a lovely person who genuinely cares about her students, but she is overall an awful teacher. My classmates and I were all teaching ourselves and each other. We did a get-to-know-you activity every day. It's nice if you were an elementary schooler, not an elementary school teacher. Tests are graded toughly and she doesn't go over quizzes/HW

Dr. Hillen seeks to connect with her students and truly cares. However, you cannot bs your way through this class. She uses active learning strategies in her classroom so that passive participation isnt an option. She expects your work to be detailed, but isnt forthcoming about it. Isnt an easy A, but attainable. A very compassionate teacher.

Dr. Hillen truly cares for all of her students & will spend extra time helping you understand concepts. She is so sweet, and cares about connecting with her students. She treats us like adults, so if youre confused or have questions ask and she always clears things up. Her class was very easy but a lot of work. She is a great professor!

Prof Hillen is so sweet and she truly cares about her students and their understanding of what she's teaching. She has no problem spending extra time on a topic if we need it. However, I feel like I've only learned two things all semester so I don't know what exactly this class was supossed to teach me. You don't necessarily need the book.

She is sweet and wants a human connection with her students. HOWEVER these things do not make for a passable teacher. Did not give adequate feedback before first test. Took 33 days to grade a 7q test and was brutal. She spends more time getting to know you than teaching. Don't know why I paid for a class where she doesn't cover the course standards
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is really sweet but she is a hard grader! She straight up threw in trick questions in the middle of a midterm. She takes FOREVER to get grades back, lots of wasted class time at the beginning of class going over class procedures. Lots of repetition in the class, feels like you're going in circles. You do not need the book!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Professor Hillen is very nice. However, her test are nothing like her lectures in the classroom. Her test are SO hard and NOTHING like she teaches. She takes forever to grade test or any other assignments. She doesnt give feedback on homework or quizzes, so youll never know if you actually understand the concept or not. BTW dont buy the book

Dr. Hillen is an extremely nice person and will go out of her way to help you. She was very accessible through email and would answer any questions I had. The main reason why I will never take her again is because she is a slow grader for how hard her assignments are. She graded the majority of our class assignments the last 2 days of the semester.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: She is a very nice professor and cares about her students. When COVID-19 struck, she still had online class like regular class. She also teaches things like there is always a student that doesnt understand in the class. That is definitely helpful, but annoying if you do understand because she teaches slow. Also, do not expect to get out early ever

Dr. Hillen is very kind and cares about her students. However, her class is so dull and she makes it so hard to understand anything. In my real life field experience for block one, my students never were a fan of her solutions either. Shes an insanely tough grader and really upped the workload after COVID-19 as well.

Dr. Hillen is super sweet and cares about her students, but her class was a little boring and always felt drawn out. Participation and attendance is mandatory so pay attention. She grades tough but always for extra credit and is there to help you, not fail you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Hillen made a concept as easy as geometry and measurements EXTREMELY DIFFICULT. This class was so hard I'm surprised I came out with a B. She speaks to you like you're in elementary school instead of trying to teach it. I would not take her again.
Terrible professor, will literally give you a F after you felt highly confident in receiving a B or A on test. Honestly needs to resign. She is a nice person but that is a decoy.
Dr. Hillen is a wonderful professor. She goes above and beyond to help everyone. I would try to take her again for 3317.

At first, I was skeptical about taking this class with her. We did "get to know you" activities and talked about 1/2 for the first 3 weeks of class, but it got better from there. It is a lot to take in since it is a class on fractions, but she is super helpful and provides good feedback. I would take her again for 3317 knowing how she is now.

Nice person, but terrible professor. Lectures are no where near what is on the test. There are only three tests, some in class quizzes, and a final exam. I worked so hard and studied for all the texts/exam and still ended up with a C in the class. I've never had a C in a math class before! I DO NOT encourage anyone to take her.

Spends more time doing get to know you activities than actually teaching math. Spends 45 minuets going over the same EASY problem from a million points of view. The tests are harder than what you are learning in class, so prepare to teach yourself. Treats students like they are third graders. Extra credit offered but not worth that much to grade!

Dr. Hillen is extremely sweet and caring. You will spend more time in class doing get to know me rather than learning about fractions. The class was super easy but I do not feel that I learned anything from it. She is very delayed in her grading, but offers several extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I wouldn't take her, I took her twice and she isn't very clear on what she expects for class. She doesn't apply what you are learning to how children think & how you will use it as a future teacher. You will leave class feeling confused as she leaves a lot of the class as student based learning, rather than giving you some solid info to work from.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: 3 test and a final. Only a few homework assignments that we not worth much. If you are only looking to pass then I wouldn't suggest her class. Her test are so thorough and require great detail that wasn't expressed in class. She wants you to learn, so if you think you're just gonna skim by, this is not the teacher or class for you. YOU WILL FAIL
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is very nice and soft spoken. Her class is kind of open ended and she lets the students discover the answer without blatantly telling us. The class may be difficult to wrap your head around be we truely learn why we do certain mathmatical algorithms.

Professor Hillen is so nice and passionate about what she teaches. She really makes everyone in her class want to become better teachers but the problem is, what she is teaching is HARD and the assessments (which are most of the grade) are really hard. You have to write out each step of what you are doing and it is very easy to miss something.

Dr. Hillen is one of the best professors I've had! She's extremely friendly and knowledgeable. 5 homework assignments, which are only graded by participation not. 3 tests and the final. I can see how this class would be difficult for some, but you'll be completely fine as long as you show up and PARTICIPATE! I've had her 3 times now! Easy A or B.

Enjoyed Professor Hillen's class. Very little homework- the majority of points come from the exams which she grades fairly. Make sure you study for the exams and attend the optional exam study sessions!

Amy is a very sweet person but isn't clear about what her expectations are. The class only consists of 3 tests, 5 homework grades, and the final. If you are not good at math you will struggle with this class. I'm an A student and will probably make a B. Very hard grader. Doesn't respond to emails.
Failed her class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: I took her this fall and she doesn't help out at all. sweet by too hard.
too much, took it and have to redo
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: failed, too hard. :( her tests are too much and expects a lot

She treat you like a child. you work on one problem the whole class but i really learned a lot in her class. she teaches good. she wants you to think and not just he feed you info. taking her again this semester

Hillen is friendly & kind, but instruction is unorganized & frustrating. Her instruction puts way too much emphasis on student ideas & discussion, leaving most everyone confused & unsure of correct methods. She doesn't always give thorough explanations, & she does not prepare you well for tests. If you're naturally good at math, you can excel.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: This class definitely tested my ability to think like an elementary student and put myself in the position to teach material clearly. I had to work hard to get a good grade in this class. Professor Hillen can be a little confusing but she is willing to help if you ask for it. There are two tests and a final. She does assign homework and quizzes.

She's extremely knowledgeable and she takes a lot of time to prepare whay she teaches. She wants you to ask questions and has already anticipated the questions you will ask. I learned so much from her. You have to work for a good grade but you can do it and you'll learn a lot! She's a great reference too.

Go to class and participate. We are discussing problems as a class for the entire time. Her test are somewhat hard. Homework, online discussions, mini quizzes, 5 tests. She does make you think about fractions and percent in a deeper sense. She's not that bad. "/

I hate her class. She comes off as nice and helpful until the first test, then she is just vague and annoying. She is too theoretical to help in the actual classroom. The degree in which she asks students to break a problem down is just nerve grating! She has you label every little thing and acts as if everything is ok.
LOVE HER.  Great teacher and great to work with. Test questions are somewhat hard, but attend class and you will make an A!

Very helpful on a 1 to 1 basis. Boring class, too much whole group discussion and not enough individual work time. Too many assessments that at times would not cover content specified. Very meticulous and tedious in grading but vague in instruction. Overall nice person but would rather walk on hot coals than sit through another one of her classes.

Enjoyed how she led class. Less Lecture and more discussion so make sure you go and are aware and partisipating, not at all hard though. Not many assignments and no homework. Make sure you always fully explain your reasoning as the whole point is to learn how to teach it she expects a deep and full understanding of various methods.

Dr. Hillen is a very helpful and friendly professor. She makes her expectations clear, and is always willing to offer further explanations when necessary. The class can be boring because a ridiculous amount of time is spent on the same topic (some times days at a time). While the class is clear, I'm not sure how much I have learned about teaching.

Dr. Hillen is a very nice professor and she is always helpful, however this class is extremely boring. Sometimes we work on one problem for 2-3 class sessions. I am not quite sure if I am even getting anything out of this class or learning? Show up to class, participate, study, and you should get an A or B.

Dr. Hillen's class is probably the most boring class I have ever taken. If you are even semi-good at math you will be bored in her class. We only covered fractions the whole semester and you are also suppose to cover decimals and ratios. Her class moves VERY slow but is easy.
Dr. Hillen is a great teacher! She makes sure the class understands the material before moving on. She also lets you use all notes, textbook, and classwork on quizzes and exams.

I really enjoyed this class. Some were bored to tears, but I really enjoyed the class. Dr. Hillen takes a different approach to teaching math that I haven't seen before, and it really takes you back to the basics.  You would be surprised at how much you have forgotten over the years! Be nice to her, and don't roll your eyes when you get bored.

The class is super easy. Attendance and participation is mandatory and plays a major part in your grade. The class is boring because you discuss the same problem over and over, but she does show you a different way of viewing math.

She is super easy, but class is soo boring! You spend at least a day, sometimes 2, on just one problem. She's not satisfied until everyone has said pretty much the exact same thing in a different way, but I guess this is the point of the class. Even though it was boring it was an easy A!!
Her class was great! You solved fractions with pictures!! It was a great semester. She does not give homework and her tests are pretty simple if you pay attention in class.
